intro: Blitum rubrum, commonly known as redroot filaree, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its basal rosette of spoon-shaped, reddish leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, along stream banks, and in disturbed areas. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants like buckwheat and sorrel. Blitum rubrum is also noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes used in native plant gardens.
